content:
• Tuesday, June 26, 2018
  • FOLD

    Amicus Therapeutics -10% on missed CMA in Europe

    • Amicus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:FOLD) is 9.9% lower after hours after it announced updates to its development program for AT-GAA for Pompe Disease, which didn't get a Conditional Marketing Authorization.
    • Meetings with the European Medicines' Agency's Scientific Advice Working Party suggested that efficacy data looked "promising" but insufficient for now.
    • SAWP was supportive of adding additional patient populations, which Amicus will pursue in 2019, to gather more data.
    • It will also be able to start Process Performance Qualification runs at commercial scale (1,000 liters).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • DRRX

    Durect -10.9%, PTIE -75% after failed Remoxy vote

    • Durect (NASDAQ:DRRX) is 10.9% lower after hours following word that its partner, Pain Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTIE), saw its Remoxy ER pain reliever fail to secure approval at a joint FDA committee meeting.
    • Pain Therapeutics has resumed trading down 75%. It had been halted today awaiting the results of the advisory committees.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:16 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment -6% after issuing downside revenue guidance

    • AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) -5.7% after-hours despite reporting better than expected FQ4 earnings and revenues, as it guides FY 2019 revenues below analyst consensus.
    • AVAV sees FY 2019 EPS of $1.10-$1.40, which includes a $0.25-$0.26 litigation settlement and appears to not be comparable to the $1.00 analyst consensus estimate, and sees revenues of $290M-$310M vs. $337M consensus.
    • For Q4 2018, gross margin of $52.2M was down 9% Y/Y, primarily due to a $9.9M decrease in product margin; as a percentage of revenue, gross margin fell to 44% from 50% in the year-ago quarter.
    • AVAV says its funded backlog as of April 30 was $174.3M vs. $70.9M a year earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 5 Comments
  • WWE

    WWE +8.1% on new U.S. flagship deals with USA, Fox

    • World Wrestling Entertainment (NYSE:WWE) is up 8.1% after hours after announcing new deals with USA Network (NASDAQ:CMCSA) and Fox Sports (FOX, FOXA) for its flagship programs in the U.S.
    • The five-year deals cover Monday Night Raw (which will continue to air on USA) and SmackDown Live (to be distributed on Fox broadcast each Friday).
    • They increase the average annual value of WWE's U.S. distribution to 3.6 times its prior deal with NBCUniversal, the company says.
    • "Substantial revenue growth" from the new U.S. deals has WWE updating its guidance, targeting adjusted OIBDA of at least $200M for 2019, which covers just three months of the new deal rates.
    • It's holding a conference call tomorrow at 8 a.m. to discuss more long-term perspective on the key deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 13 Comments
  • ASCMA

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/26/2018)

    • Top gainers: ASCMA +4%. RNG +4%. SFUN +2.8%. AXTI +2.1%. ICHR +1.9%.
    • Top Losers: FOLD -10.3%. CNXM -9.6%. SONC -7.1%.  SBLK -6.9%. VTR -4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 23 Comments
  • IRBT

    IRobot +1.5% on favorable initial patent decision

    • IRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) announces an initial determination recommending a limited exclusion order on bObsweep, Hoover, and Shenzhen ZhiYi Technology products that have infringed iRobot patents.
    • The recommendation is now before the ITC commissioners with a final determination expected by October 25. If the Commissioners agree, the exclusion order will go into effect upon publication of the final determination regardless of appeals.
    • IRobot shares are up 1.5% aftermarket to $76.53.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • UNIT

    Bloomberg: Searchlight offering 5.5M Uniti Group shares

    • Searchlight Capital Partners is offering 5.5M shares of its Uniti Group (NASDAQ:UNIT) holdings, Bloomberg reports.
    • The firm will sell via UBS at $20.60-$20.80/share, according to the report.
    • That's a discount of 1.7%-2.7%.
    • Shares declined 2% today, adding on to a 5% drop on Monday; they're flat after hours today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 83 Comments
  • DAC

    Danaos beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Danaos (NYSE:DAC): Q1 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $111.85M (+1.6% Y/Y) beats by $7.87M.
    • Shares +11.11%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 10 Comments
  • HEAR

    Turtle Beach +1.5% on new esports partnership

    • Turtle Beach (NASDAQ:HEAR) announces a partnership with Australian esports organization Tainted Minds.
    • Tainted Minds’ pro gaming teams and players will all use Turtle Beach’s Elite Pro line of audio equipment. 
    • Tainted Minds competitive teams cover a variety of games including Call of Duty, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, and Fortnite. 
    • Turtle Beach shares are up 1.5% aftermarket to $21.55.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic -4.6% as revenues decline, miss in Q3

    • Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC) is off 4.6% in postmarket trading after fiscal Q3 revenues declined and missed, though it pointed to upward-trending same-store sales.
    • System same-store sales dipped 0.2% driven by declines at franchise drive-ins (company drive-ins ticked up 0.2%).
    • Adjusted EPS rose 21% and topped expectations; lower tax rates from tax reform added about $0.06/share of the adjusted EPS of $0.52.
    • “Our third quarter same-store sales performance reflects a material improvement in trend, driven by ongoing initiatives to increase marketing reach, refresh our advertising creative and introduce relevant new products," says CEO Cliff Hudson.
    • For the full year, it now expects EPS of $1.45-$1.49 (in line with expectations for $1.47) -- excluding tax reform impact, a gain of 3-6% Y/Y.
    • In the forecast it expects system same-store sales down 1% or flat; free cash flow of about $60M; and drive-in-level margins of 15.3%-15.6% (depending on company same-store sales growth).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • AMD

    Semiconductors have better day on China-US tech clarity

    • Semiconductors have a better day, taking back some of yesterday’s losses thanks to increasing clarity regarding US-China tech relations.
    • The improvement follows President Trump’s remarks to reporters about the Committee on Foreign Investments in the US (CFIUS) protecting American technology from foreign companies.
    • Senate-passed legislation would strengthen the CFIUS authority to include reviewing transfers of minority interests in companies with critical tech and infrastructure. The legislation still needs to pass the House.
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is up 0.33%.
    • Top semiconductor movers include: AMD (AMD +2.5%), Micron (MU +2.6%), Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR +2%), Texas Instruments (TXN +1.2%), Lam Research (LRCX +1.7%), and Qorvo (QRVO +1.7%), Cypress Semiconductors (CY +1.1%), and Maxim Integrated Products (MXIM +1.6%).
    • Previously: Micron +2.1% after UBS upgrade (June 26)
    • Previously: Intel -1.8% after Bernstein moves to Underperform (update) (June 26)
    • Previously: Nvidia 1.4% after Benchmark New Buy rating (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 115 Comments
  • BAC

    Financials hurt by flatter yield curve, ebbing consumer confidence

    • The S&P 500 Financials Index falls for the 12th straight today, the longest losing streak ever.
    • The flattening yield curve and consumer confidence are both cause for concern. As well, investors are waiting for the second half of the Federal Reserve's stress test for financial institutions, which will determine how much in dividends they'll be able to pay and/or how many shares they'll be able to buy back.
    • The S&P 500 Financials -0.3% late Tuesday.
    • Also, the Financial Select Sector SPDR EFT (XLF -0.3%) has declined in the past seven trading days.
    • By late afternoon trading though, Bank of America (BAC +0.4%), Citigroup (C +1%), JPMorgan(JPM +0.1%), and Goldman Sachs (GS +0.1%) were up.
    • Wells Fargo (WFC -1%) and Morgan Stanley (MS -0.1%) are down as are most regional banks, including Fifth Third (FITB -1.5%), KeyCorp (KEY -1.2%), and M&T Bank (MTB -1%).
    • Previously: Consumer confidence drops for second straight month (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 26 Comments
  • AMZN

    MoffettNathanson: Amazon should buy CBS to take on Netflix

    • MoffettNathanson senior research analyst Michael Nathanson says Amazon (AMZN +1.8%) should purchase a media company like CBS (CBS -0.7%) to expand its content library to rival Netflix.
    • Nathanson says Amazon Prime Video’s growth could prove slow if Amazon tries to build marketing while producing its own shows. 
    • CBS is currently in the middle of a court battle between National Amusements’ Shari Redstone and CBS CEO Les Moonves. An October 3 court date could decide the control of the company. 
    • Nathanson does doubt that CBS will be “given their freedom from NAI’s control” but says “an M&A premium would quickly emerge” if it did happen.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 24 Comments
  • KMI

    KMI upgraded at Bernstein as Trans Mountain sale 'start of something good'

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI +2.2%) moves higher after Bernstein upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform with a $22 price target, up from $21, saying KMI's sale of the Trans Mountain pipeline to the Canadian government may "finally be the start of something good" for the company.
    • The sale will move KMI to 4.7x debt to EBITDA from 5.1x previously and remove a lot of uncertainty and capex, Bernstein's Jean Ann Salisbury says, hoping the company now will sell its enhanced oil recovery business for a good price to further reduce its leverage and sell other non-core assets.
    • With all that done, Salisbury tells KMI it can "declare yourself the safe, defensive, 80% take or pay equivalent, 4.5x midstream company - what MLPs are supposed to be!"
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 65 Comments
  • LINK

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 PM (06/26/2018)

    • Gainers: LINK +30%. TSRI +27%. ABIL +22%. CLPS +21%. CPAH +19%.
    • Losers: AGMH -12%. OTCPK:LFIN -9%. SGLB -8%. TAOP -5%. IDN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • TSLA

    Musk tweet on trucks boosts Tesla

    • "The Tesla [pickup] Truck will have dual motor all-wheel drive w/crazy torque & a suspension that dynamically adjusts for load," tweets Elon Musk. "Those will be standard."
    • Already in the green on the session, Tesla (TSLA +2.5%) moves a bit higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 348 Comments
  • UPL

    Ultra Petroleum +7% as Avenue Capital discloses 5.48% active stake

    • Ultra Petroleum (UPL +7.8%) pops after Avenue Capital Management discloses a 5.48% active stake, saying it plans to engage in discussions on ways to maximize shareholder value.
    • Avenue Capital wants UPL to review opportunities including changes to capital structure, utilization of significant assets and/or possible strategic transactions, as well as potential changes in operations, management, board composition, governance, dividend policy, corporate strategy and other areas.
    • UPL shares have plunged 76% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 44 Comments
  • CPB

    Analysts show little appetite for Kraft Heinz takeover of Campbell Soup

    • Campbell Soup (CPB -1.6%) bubbled up 9% in yesterday's trade following a report that Kraft Heinz (KHC -0.4%) is interested in a takeover, but analysts are out pouring cold water on the likelihood of a deal.
    • “We would be surprised if Kraft Heinz wanted Campbell Soup, a company that does not solve Kraft Heinz’s growth problems and is facing numerous internal challenges,” J.P. Morgan analysts say.
    • “While Campbell Soup no doubt brings significant synergies to Kraft Heinz, we do not believe it has the international presence and growing categories necessary to justify an acquisition by the company,” according to analysts at Stifel.
    • If "Kraft Heinz were to buy Campbell Soup, where sales growth has been lackluster for most of the last decade, this is unlikely to improve the company’s reputation," Bernstein's Alexia Howard writes, adding that KHC would be better served by snapping up a consumer products company with more overseas exposure, such as Mondelez (NASDAQ:MDLZ), PepsiCo (NYSE:PEP) or Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE:CL).
    • On a similar vein, Piper Jaffray's Michael Lavery says CPB is not a good fit for KHC, which is seeking "strong brands that can travel internationally," and that a play for CPB might disappoint for investors who believe KHC can "dream bigger."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 31 Comments
  • IMASY

    Eutelsat backs off of Inmarsat offer; IMASY -15%

    • A day after confirming it was considering a bid for Inmarsat (OTCPK:IMASY), Eutelsat (OTCPK:EUTLY) says it won't make an offer.
    • Inmarsat has slid 14.7% in OTC trading, while Eutelsat is up 5.4%.
    • The declaration clears a path for EchoStar (SATS -1.1%) in its own pursuit, though it's been rebuffed by Inmarsat in its recent overtures.
    • Eutelsat won't make another run at Inmarsat unless it has Inmarsat board consent or another party makes a firm offer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • NEXT

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/26/2018)

    • Gainers: NEXT +11%. AMRS +10%. BWP +9%. OSN +8%. ZN +8%.
    • Losers: GEVO -19%. SBGL -11%. SND -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • AKAO

    Achaogen down 20% after FDA approval

    • The approval for Zemdri was just for urinary tract infections, but not bloodstream infections. Also the label will exclude data from the Phase 3 "Care" trial.
    • Needham bull Alan Carr says the decision was as expected, and the label issue should have little impact on use of the drug.
    • He expects a July launch, with pricing to be inline with competitors at about $1K per day. Carr does have concern with the size of the carbapenem-resistant market, but Zemdri does have a differentiated mechanism of action.
    • AKAO -21.9%
    • Previously: Achaogen's Zemdri antibiotic approved by FDA for urinary tract infections (June 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 53 Comments
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks -2.5% as Goldman goes to Neutral

    • AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX) is off 2.5% following Goldman Sachs' downgrade to Neutral.
    • The company faces slowing ad growth as The Walking Dead matures, to go along with ongoing affiliate fee pressures in pay TV for stand-alone content companies, analyst Drew Borst says. While M&A is coming up more and more for such companies, AMC is a controlled company with a relatively limited library, crimping that potential catalyst. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He's got a price target of $70, implying 11% upside from today's lower price.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • CLDC

    China Lending more than doubles on heavy volume

    • China Lending (NASDAQ:CLDC) more than doubles (+159%) today with no specific news out.
    • About 7.78M shares changed hands by early afternoon trading, swamping its three-month daily average of 25,071 shares.
    • Currently trading at about $4.99, still down 20% from 52-week high of $6.24 on Oct. 13.
    • Previously: China Lending soars 44%, still about 50% off 52-week high (June 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • CLDC

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/26/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +158%. SPHS +44%. TSRI +36%. LINK +32%. ACHV +28%. XBIO +25%. LEE +25%. ASCMA +23%. ABIL +22%.NAKD +19%. PBYI +18%.
    • Losers: ATV -25%. AKAO -23%. GEVO -18%. SLS -15%. FRED -13%. ICLK -13%. HTZ -11%. SBGL -11%. LIFE -11%.SLNO -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLDC

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/26/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +160%. CCCR-OLD +15%. JP +9%. FPAY +8%. SAR +7%.
    • Losers: TREE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • CBOE

    CBOE rises after JPMorgan upgrades to neutral

    • Cboe Global Markets  (NASDAQ:CBOE) +3.3% after JPMorgan upgrades to neutral from underweight.
    • CBOE rose as high as $107.66, its highest since May 18. Shares are down 13% year-to-date.
    • Previously: Cboe Global Markets volume dips from last year's busy May (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM

  • Crude buyers must cut all Iranian oil imports by November, U.S. says

    • U.S. WTI crude oil climbs above $70/bbl for the first time since May after the U.S. State Department says buyers of Iranian oil must wind down those purchases by November or risk sanctions; WTI +3.5% at $70.50/bbl, Brent +2.2% at $76.39/bbl.
    • The Trump administration has not yet held talks with China, India or Turkey about their purchases of Iranian crude, but it intends to pressure them to entirely cut their imports under threat of sanctions, says a senior State Department official.
    • Buyers of Iranian crude had expected the U.S. would allow them time to reduce oil imports over a much longer period by issuing sanctions waivers if significant efforts were made to cut their purchases, based on previous comments from Trump administration officials as well as the Obama administration’s earlier decision to wean the world off Iranian oil over several years.
    • Also supporting crude prices today are uncertainty over Libyan crude exports and doubts over OPEC’s ability to increase production quickly enough to prevent a shortfall in global supplies.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 70 Comments
  • TSRI

    TSR jumps 31% on request to pursue sale

    • Joseph F. Hughes (former Chairman and CEO) and Winifred M. Hughes holding ~41.8% stake in the TSR (TSRI +31.8%) request board to pursue a sale of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • BWP

    Boardwalk Pipeline +9% after class action lawsuit settlement

    • Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP +8.8%) enjoys strong gains after confirming a settlement in the class action litigation filed by TAM Capital Management and other investors in connection with the potential exercise of the call right for its common units.
    • In summary, if BWP general partner Loews (L -0.4%) elects to exercise its call right no later than June 29, all claims relating to the litigation will be released and the litigation ended, subject to court approval.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 19 Comments
  • PF

    Pinnacle Foods +3.5% on report of advanced ConAgra buyout talks

    • Pinnacle Foods (NYSE:PF) is jumping, up 3.5%, on a CNBC report that ConAgra Brands (CAG -0.2%) is in advanced talks to acquire the company.
    • That deal would have a combined market cap of more than $23B and build the country's second-biggest frozen-food company, behind Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY).
    • The deal would be in cash and stock, sources told the network, and could come as soon as this week.
    • Previously: Pinnacle Food +3% amid ConAgra talk (Jun. 21 2018)
    • Previously: Pinnacle-ConAgra merger speculation picks up again (May. 21 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • SPOT

    Spotify hires Conde Nast's Ostroff to lead content

    • Spotify (SPOT +2.7%) has named Conde Nast's Dawn Ostroff to take over as chief content officer.
    • She'll have responsibility for all of the company's content partnerships across music, audio and video.
    • Ostroff has been president of Conde Nast Entertainment, where she's worked for seven years; she also developed several series as president of CW/UPN, including Gossip Girl, Smallville, One Tree Hill and America's Next Top Model.
    • The move's effective at the end of July.
    • Previously: Spotify +2.4% as Barclays joins bulls (Jun. 26 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • NAKD

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/26/2018)

    • Gainers: NAKD +14%. THRM +9%. TOUR +8%. HOME +6%. VRS +5%.
    • Losers: KODK -8%. TIS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple roundup: Production starts on iPhone 6s in India, Barclays forecasts June Q

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) reportedly starts production on iPhone 6s devices in India with plans to produce another model in the country at a later date.
    • Apple previously opened an Indian manufacturing facility to produce the iPhone SE for Indian customers. 
    • The third model could be the iPhone 6s Plus.
    • Apple needs to manufacture the phones in India to get around rising import taxes, which would help keep device prices down in a cost-conscious local market.  
    • In other Apple news, Barclays is out with estimates on short- and long-term Apple performance predictions. 
    • Analyst Mark Moskowitz says the June quarter will be influenced by iPhone carrier promotions in the US and China, foreign exchange rates, and the new free iCloud storage trial. Barclays expects the US dollar to depreciate 4% Y/Y for the June quarter. 
    • The analyst raises his EPS estimate 2% for FY18 to $12.25, but the FY19 EPS estimate drops 1% to $12.77. 
    • Firm keeps Apple at Neutral with a $175 price target. 
    • Apple shares are up 1.4% to $184.67.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 121 Comments
  • RCKT

    Rocket Pharmaceuticals files $300M mixed securities shelf

    • Rocket Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RCKT) files for a $300M mixed securities shelf offering.
    • Rocket shares are down 0.4% to $20.52.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • HMNY

    MoviePass parent -13.2% as AMC subscriptions launch

    • MoviePass parent Helios & Matheson (NASDAQ:HMNY) is off 13.2% today with the official launch of AMC Theatres' (AMC -1.8%) monthly subscription plan.
    • AMC Stubs A-List is "simple and sustainable," the theater chain says, in a shot at MoviePass plans criticized on the Street for being too cheap to survive. AMC's plan allows members to see three movies a week at AMC locations, regardless of format, for $19.95/month.
    • The new AMC plan has seen "overwhelmingly positive response" since the company announced it, says CEO Adam Aron.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 137 Comments
  • SLDB

    Solid Biosciences drops 11.5% on retirement of co-founder and president

    • Solid Biosciences (NASDAQ:SLDB) announces that Dr. Martin Freed has joined the board. He most recently served as the CMO of Civitas Therapeutics, which was acquired by Acorda in 2014.
    • Solid co-founder, director, and president Gilad Hayeem has retired from his role as president and the board to “pursue other activities.” 
    • Co-Founder and CEO Ilan Ganot assumes the role of president.   
    • Solid Biosciences shares are down 11.5% to $38.20.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • AUY

    Yamana Gold starts commercial production at Argentina's Cerro Moro mine

    • Yamana Gold (AUY -2%) says it has started commercial production at its Cerro Moro gold and silver mine in Argentina.
    • AUY expects Cerro Moro to "generate a disproportionate amount of cash flow and free cash flow relative to the comparatively small-scale nature of the operation."
    • When production ramps up, Cerro Moro is expected to yield 85K oz. of gold and 3.75M oz. of silver this year, nearly all of it in H2, rising to 125K gold oz. and 6M silver oz. in 2019, which should help AUY’s plans to ramp up gold production by 20% and its silver production by 200% next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 4 Comments
  • GTN

    Gray Television up another 10% as analysts praise Raycom deal

    • Gray Television (NYSE:GTN) is up 10.4%, another double digit gain following yesterday's 16% rise on the heels of a deal to buy Raycom Media for $3.6B.
    • Wells Fargo's Marci Ryvicker notes a deal "as clean as they come," filled with positives including culture fit and a focus on high-quality news. It's the "most accretive deal we have seen in this space, she writes; she has a Street-high price target of $28 on Gray, still 70% upside from today's sharply higher price. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Barrington's James Goss says Raycom is arguably Gray's closest comparable, so the deal leverages operating advantages and doubles Gray's footprint. He has a $19 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • ACHV

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/26/2018)

    • Gainers: ACHV +38%. GNPX +20%. PBYI +19%. SPHS +15%. AVGR +14%.
    • Losers: AKAO -25%. XBIO -19%. SLS -16%. SLDB -11%. COOL -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • KOS

    Kosmos Energy -6% as Suriname well fails to hit paydirt

    • Kosmos Energy (KOS -5.8%) is sharply lower after coming up dry at its latest exploration well offshore Suriname.
    • KOS says its Anapai-1A well in Block 45 is being plugged and abandoned after failing to find hydrocarbons after being drilled to a total depth of 4,556 meters.
    • “We are still in the early stages of exploring this newly emerging basin and our forward drilling program remains unchanged given the independent nature of the prospects," the company says.
    • KOS holds rights in the Block 45 and Block 42 contract areas under production sharing contracts with Suriname's government; KOS is the exploration operator of Block 45 and is joined by its 50-50 partner Chevron (NYSE:CVX), and KOS is the exploration operator of Block 42 and is joined by partners CVX and Hess, each with 33.33%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • GNPX

    Genprex up 16% as it selects clinic for Oncoprex

    • The company has chosen 4Clinics Group Sprl to provide support for the clinical development of Oncoprex for the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer.
    • COO Julien Pham: "This is an important step forward for Genprex (GNPX +16.5%) as we expand the scope of the Oncoprex clinical development program to build on the encouraging data we've compiled to date."
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • SCHN

    More on Schnitzer Steel's Q3 results

    • Schnitzer Steel Industries (SCHN -0.1%) reported Q3 revenue growth of 36.7% Y/Y to $652.42M. Segment revenue: Auto & metal recycling $529.6M (+37% Y/Y) and Cascade steel & scarp $130M (+35% Y/Y).
    • Q3 Overall operating margin improved by 384 bps to 7.8%. Segment operating margin: AMR improved by 272 bps to 10.4% and CSS improved by 709 bps to 8.3%.
    • Auto & metal recycling results: Ferrous revenue $364M (+54% Y/Y) with a 19% Y/Y increase in volumes to 983k LT at an avg. sale price of $337 per LT (+31% Y/Y). Non-ferrous revenue $127 (+12% Y/Y) with 3% Y/Y decrease in volumes to 146M LB at an avg. sales price of $0.74 per LB (+14% Y/Y). Cars purchased for retail 109k (+1% Y/Y).
    • Cascade steel & scrap results: Steel revenue $104M (+27% Y/Y) with finished steel volumes at 140k ST (-1% Y/Y) at an avg. price of $703 per ST (+29% Y/Y). Recycling revenue $26M (+85% Y/Y).

  • INFI

    Infinity Pharmaceuticals +12% on collaboration pact with Arcus

    • Infinity Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:INFI) jumps 12% in premarket trading after announcing an agreement with Arcus Biosciences (NYSE:RCUS) to evaluate two triple combination therapies in selected tumor types that typically show minimal response to checkpoint inhibition monotherapy.
    • The company's will evaluate Infinity's IPI-549 in combination with Arcus's AB928 dual adenosine receptor antagonist and AB122, Arcus's anti-PD-1 antibody, as well as IPI-549 in combination with AB928 and chemotherapy in patients with triple negative breast cancer or ovarian cancer in four separate cohorts.
    • The four cohorts will be incorporated into Arcus's recently initiated Phase 1/1b trial to evaluate AB928 combinations in TNBC and ovarian cancer.
    • Under the terms of the agreement, Infinity and Arcus will share equally expenses related to the four triple-combination cohorts to evaluate the safety and activity of IPI-549 + AB928 + AB122 and IPI-549 + AB928 + chemotherapy. Each of the four triple-combination cohorts will enroll approximately 15 patients. Topline data from these studies are expected in 2019.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Infinity Pharma's lead candidate IPI-549 shows shows positive effect in early-stage monotherapy study but shares down 16% premarket (Nov. 10, 2017)
